intro: Panstrepis paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical orchid, is a rare and enigmatic flowering plant native to the remote highlands of Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, bi-colored flowers that display a unique combination of purple and yellow hues. The plant belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is notable for its unusual growth habit, often growing as a lithophyte on rocky substrates. Its flowers are highly specialized, with intricate structures that facilitate pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Panstrepis paradoxa is considered a conservation concern.
